title: R-Ladies Tbilisi: Webinar: Working with text in R
description:
R-Ladies Tbilisi is pleased to host Ella Kaye.
Ella is a PhD student in Statistics at the University of Warwick. She followed her undergraduate degree in Mathematics and Philosophy with Masters degrees in History and Philosophy of Science and then Mathematics Education. Her interest in statistics was first piqued as a secondary school maths teacher when thinking about how to make the subject interesting for teenagers. An MSc in Applied Statistics followed (via a couple of years in working in market research), which lead to the PhD. Ella is an R enthusiast and package author, and the co-organiser of the Oxford R User Group.

R provides excellent tools for working with text. This tidyverse-based talk will provide an overview of some of the fantastic packages available for this, including (but not limited to) `stringr`, `RVerbalExpressions`, `tidytext` and `wordcloud`.

Please register here to receive the event link: https://tinyurl.com/tbsreg

ელა ვარვიკის უნივერსიტეტში სტატისტიკის დოქტორანტურის სტუდენტია. მან ბაკალვრზე მათემატიკა და ფილოსოფია ისწავლა, მაგისტრატურა კი ისტორია და მეცნიერების ფილოსოფიაში, შემდეგ კი მათემატიკის განათლებაში გააკეთა. ელა სტატისტიკით განსაკუთრებით მაშინ დაინტერესდა, როცა სკოლაში მათემატიკის მასწავლებლად მუშაობდა და ფიქრობდა თუ როგორ გაეხადა ეს საგანი მოსწავლეებისთვის უფრო საინტერესო. შედეგად, ელამ, გამოყენებითი სტატისტიკის მაგისტრის წოდება მიიღო, რასაც შემდეგ დოქტორის ხარისხიც მოჰყვა. ელა R-ის პაკეტის შემქმნელი და Oxford R User Group-ის ერთ-ერთი ორგანიზატორია.

R ტექსტთან მუშაობის შესანიშნავ საშუალებებს გვთავაზობს. ამ tidyverse-ზე დაფუძნებულ შეხვედრაზე განვიხილავთ შესანიშნავ პაკეტებს, როგორებიცაა ‘stringr`, `RVerbalExpressions`, `tidytext` and `wordcloud`.

შეხვედრის ლინკის მისაღებად, გთხოვთ დარეგისტრირდეთ აქ: https://tinyurl.com/tbsreg

title: R-Ladies Tbilisi: Webinar: Finding hidden topics in documents and other text analyses in R
description:
Rocío Joo (University of Florida) will present a procedure to identify topics in a set of documents using an example of scientific articles in a field of science, movement ecology. To tell the whole story behind this case study, she will briefly explain how she addressed the identification of the papers of interest, show some code for downloading articles, extracting the text and finally perform data analysis. The latter will mainly consist of fitting Latent Dirichlet Allocation models to identify the latent or hidden topics.
If there will be time, she will also talk about other types of text analysis.

Rocío is an ecological statistician, currently working as a postdoctoral research associate at University of Florida, investigating animal movement models, and other quantitative methods and R tools to analyze movement. She recently published a scientific article examining R packages for movement (https://arxiv.org/abs/1901.05935) and maintains a CRAN Task View of those packages (https://cran.r-project.org/web/views/Tracking.html) . She is part of R-ladies and participates in the Latin American R community.
https://rociojoo.github.io/

Please register here to receive the event link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/11bZ_ASK7VlAst7Rwxyt_H9ZYWHediDKgzGynP8bek1g .

შეხვედრაზე როსიო სამეცნიერო სტატიების მაგალითზე წარმოგვიდგენს დოკუმენტში თემების იდენტიფიცირების პროცედურას, გვაჩვენებს სტატიების გადმოსაწერ და ტექსტის მოსაპოვებელ კოდს; ბოლოს კი გვაჩვენებს როგორ გავაანალიზოთ მიღებული მონაცემები. ანალიზის ნაწილი უმეტესწილად მოიცავს დირიშლეს მოდელის მორგებას, რომელიც დაფარული თემების იდენტიფიცირებაში გვეხმარება.
დრო თუ დარჩება, როსიო ტექსტის სხვა ტიპის ანალიზსაც წარმოგვიდგენს.

როსიო ეკოლოგიის სტატისტიკოსია. ის ამჟამად პოსტდოქტორული მკვლევარია ფლორიდის უნივერსიტეტში და R-ის ინსტრუმენტების გამოყენებით ცხოველების მოძრაობას აანალიზებს. როსიომ ახლახანს სამეცნიერო სტატია გამოაქვეყნა, სადაც ამ თემაზე R-ის პაკეტებს განიხილავს (https://arxiv.org/abs/1901.05935 / https://cran.r-project.org/web/views/Tracking.html). როსიო R-ladies და ლათინური ამერიკის R-ის საზოგდოების აქტიური წევრია.
https://rociojoo.github.io/

შეხვედრის ლინკის მისაღებად, გთხოვთ დარეგისტრირდეთ აქ: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/11bZ_ASK7VlAst7Rwxyt_H9ZYWHediDKgzGynP8bek1g .

title: R-Ladies Quito: Tómate un café con nosotras y conoce a las R-Ladies de Ecuador
description:
Las R-Ladies de Ecuador: Quito, Guayaquil y Galápagos, unen fuerzas durante la pandemia para organizar una serie de webinars sobre programación en R. Todo mientras disfrutamos de una tacita de nuestro café o té favorito.

Empezaremos esta serie con una presentación sobre las R-Ladies en Ecuador. Compartiremos nuestras motivaciones para iniciar un capítulo de R-Ladies, así como los retos y éxitos logrados. También daremos oportunidades a los participantes de compartir sus experiencias y expectativas con R.
Únete a nuestro evento, no importa tu nivel de experiencia o conocimiento con R.

Incentivamos especialmente a mujeres y personas de grupos minoritarios a que se unan a nuestros eventos.

No olviden su café o té y las ganas de compartir, sus dudas, expectativas y ganas de compartir con la comunidad R-Ladies.

title: R-Ladies Dallas: Data Analysis with R - Class Project Selection
description:
I'm excited about our plan to enhance our programming skills through an online learning experience. As a group, we decided that we will focus on the "Data Analysis with R" course taught by Facebook instructors on the Udacity learning platform. This will ensure that we are all on the same page when we're ready to kick off our R-Ladies Dallas group project. The course is available for free at the following link: https://www.udacity.com/course/data-analysis-with-r--ud651

In this meetup, we will discuss any remaining questions that you may have about the course material. We will discuss options for our the class project.

*** CLASS PROJECT ***

To help us all get a firmer understanding of the concepts learned in the course, we have decided to work on a class project. Members have already started to post suggestions in the Slack channel.

To prepare for the event, please come with suggestions as to a specific dataset and use case that you think would be a good fit for our meetup project. An ideal project would allow us to grow our skills in most of these areas.

* Data loading
* Data manipulation
* Data visualization
* Single variable analysis
* Bivariate analysis

*************************

Please join the #learning channel in our R-Ladies Dallas Slack community so that we can discuss the course and ask/answer questions you may have about the material. Slack sign-up info provided below.

Agenda
------------------------------
Part 1: Lessons 1 - 4
Part 2: Lessons 5 - 8
Part 3: Lessons 9 - 10
Class Project < -------- this meetup event

Also, please take time to watch the videos and work through the exercises.

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the webinar series and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Webinar + Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

About R-Ladies Dallas

R-Ladies Dallas welcomes members of all R proficiency levels, whether you're a new or aspiring R user, or an experienced R programmer interested in mentoring, networking & expert upskilling. Our non-profit, civil society community is designed to develop our members' R skills & knowledge through social, collaborative learning & sharing. Supporting minority identity access to STEM skills & careers, the Free Software Movement, and contributing to the global R community!

A local chapter of R-Ladies Global, R-Ladies Dallas exists to promote gender diversity in the R community worldwide. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R. As a founding principle, there is no cost or charge to participate in any of our R-Ladies communities around the world.

Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies, and by being respectful of the fact that this event is primarily for women/non-binary/female-identifying individuals.

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: R-Ladies Belo Horizonte: We R Ladies - R Markdown
description:
Inscrições em: https://www.sympla.com.br/r-markdown__895355

Quem somos nós?
O R-Ladies Belo Horizonte faz parte de uma organização mundial para promover a diversidade de gênero na comunidade da linguagem computacional estatística (R). Nossa principal missão é apoiar os gêneros minoritários para alcançar seu potencial de programação, construindo uma rede global colaborativa de líderes, mentores, aprendizes e desenvolvedoras para facilitar o progresso individual e coletivo em todo o mundo. Também tentamos promover nos nossos eventos, palestras referentes ao empreendedorismo feminino e diversidade para que as mulheres do ambiente sintam-se engajadas a correrem atrás do seu espaço no mercado.

R Markdown — A ferramenta mais versátil e linde de documentação!

Nível de Habilidade: Intermediária

O que você vai aprender neste curso?

• Chunks para gráficos e tabelas (e parâmetros como eval, echo, message)
• Tabset
• Adicionar links
• Negrito/ itálico/ títulos
• Índice lateral
• Equações simples
• Citações e notas de rodapé
Tópicos Avançados:
• Relatórios com parâmetros
• Documentos iterativos

O que você precisa ter?
Para acompanhar o curso online, o ideal é ter acesso a um computador e internet rápida. Antes de iniciar o curso você receberá um guia com as informações sobre o que precisa ser instalado e como fazer isso.

Precisa ter algum conhecimento prévio?
Há a necessidade de ter pelo menos um conhecimento básico no R.

Vai ter certificado?
Vai sim, todo mundo que fizer o curso terá direito a um certificado de 3h por curso.

O curso é gratuito?
Sim.

O que é o Projeto Animal?

O projeto Animal é um grupo de voluntários particular, e dessa forma não recebe nenhum recurso público. Atua com recursos próprios e doações recebidas. Sabemos que o trabalho de cuidados com os animais resgatados gera custos como: alimentação, vacinas, medicamentos, produtos de higiene e limpeza. Por isso contamos com a ajuda de vocês para manter esse projeto incrível funcionando.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Você pode ajudar doando itens como: Ração para cães e gatos, medicamentos, jornal, material de limpeza e outros!!! Ou pode fazer uma doação de qualquer valor.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

title: R-Ladies Milan: Donne e data science: come trovare la tua strada
description:
Donne e data science: come trovare la tua strada. Round table con 6 data scientists con background e profili professionali diversi.

L'evento è aperto a tutti e a tutti i livelli di esperienza. L'evento è gratuito, in lingua italiana e prevede il seguente programma:
-45’ di discussione in cui 6 donne nel mondo della data science racconteranno le loro esperienze. Quali professioni ci sono e come capire il ruolo più adatto in un team di Data Science? Quali sono le differenze tra il mondo professionale e l’ambiente accademico? Quali risorse utilizzare per imparare e su quali skills focalizzarsi? Rimanere in Italia o cercare un lavoro all’estero? Quali sono le principali applicazioni di data science nell'industria? E' necessario avere un profilo tecnico per avere una carriera nel data science?
- 30’ di Q&A session (sessione di domande&risposte) in cui risponderemo alle vostre domande.

Speakers:

- Sara Iacozza: Dottorata in psicologia cognitiva e neuroscienze, lavora come data storyteller per /Data. Si occupa di ricerca di mercato e produce business insights utilizzando dati quantitativi e storytelling.
- Giovanna de Vincenzo: Data scientist specializzata in Data Visualization per il business, ha conseguito il master Big Data in Business per Data Scientist
- Parvaneh Shafiei: Senior data scientist con oltre 5 anni di esperienza nell'applicazione di Machine Learning, Intelligenza artificiale e analisi avanzata per problemi aziendali
- Oriana Angelucci: è una Senior business translator. Ha lavorato nella ricerca di mercato e ora si è concentrata sulla trasformazione basata sui dati di Customer Relationship Management attraverso l'applicazione di analisi avanza
- Cristina Muschitiello: Phd in Statistica Metodologica, R-Developer, Ricercatore e Data Scientist. Attualmente Data Scientist presso infocamere, collabora altresì con il Consiglio per la ricerca in agricoltura e l'analisi dell'economia agraria (CREA) dove si occupa di statistiche per l'agricoltura
- Francesca Rosa: Associate Statistician @ UNODC

Vi aspettiamo!

title: R-Ladies New York: [Online event] Leading R Trainings & Prototyping with flexdashboards
description:
Our very own R-Ladies NYC board members Erin Grand and Kaelen Medeiros will give two short talks this month on leading R trainings for coworkers and flexdashboard!

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page and sent to all attendees at noon on the day of the event. *Note: Please check your spam or "Promotions" tab (if a Gmail user) for this Meetup announcement email if it does not appear in your inbox. Email [masked] prior to the event if you do not receive it.*

Agenda (times approximate):
7-7:05 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:05-7:30: "Leading R Trainings for Coworkers" by Erin Grand
7:30-7:55: "flexdashboard for Prototyping and Profit" by Kaelen Medeiros
7:55-8:15: Questions and wrap-up

--- Talk Abstracts ---

"Leading R Trainings for Coworkers"
Speaker: Erin Grand

Abstract: Erin has lead a set of 6+ R trainings for her coworkers ranging from "Introduction to Tidyverse" to "Using SQL and R Together." Leading such trainings, while using many of the same teaching skills, offer different challenges from teaching in a workshop or classroom setting. Erin will discuss the Why's, How's, and Best Practices she's learned over the past few years of leading trainings.

Bio: Erin works as a Data Scientist at Uncommon Schools where she trains coworkers in R as well as maintaining two R packages. Prior to Uncommon, she worked as a Data Scientist at Crisis Text Line, and a software programmer at NASA while completing her Data Science Masters at Columbia University. Before data science, Erin researched star formation and taught introductory courses in astronomy and physics at the University of Maryland.

"flexdashboard for Prototyping and Profit"
Speaker: Kaelen Medeiros

Abstract: The flexdashboard package allows you to build Shiny dashboards quickly using a RMarkdown document. This is advantageous in situations where you need to prototype a data product (often a dashboard or interactive report) and need to sell stakeholders on the value of the product built. Kaelen will talk about the basics of using flexdashboard and then give tips on utilizing it to build data product MVPs (minimum viable products) to communicate vision to stakeholders, plus discuss flexdashboard extensions and how to go about converting your flexdash to a Shiny dashboard (if you're ready or even need to!)

Bio: Kaelen is a data scientist at Medidata Solutions where they work as an R programmer on the microservices team. They've also worked at Spring Health, DataCamp, HERE Technologies, and have done a fair amount of R and Shiny consulting on the side. Kaelen was at various times a film theorist, preschool teacher, test prep tutor, videographer, and nanny before getting a MS in biostatistics from LSU Health Sciences Center in 2016 and starting to work as a statistician and data scientist. They have a cat named Scully and enjoy talking about podcats, aliens, data, and would love to see a photo of your pet if you're sharing.

---

title: R-Ladies New York: [Online event] Q&A with Authors of "Build a Career in Data Science"
description:
Authors of "Build a Career in Data Science" Emily Robinson and Jacqueline Nolis will read selections from their book and discuss why they were meaningful and what thinking went into making it. In this session you’ll learn about some of the higher-level thinking that went into designing a book to help people excel in their data science careers, as well as hear stories from Emily and Jacqueline’s pasts that ended up shaping the narrative. After Emily and Jacqueline discuss their book, the floor will open so anyone can ask their data science career questions!

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page and sent to all attendees at noon on the day of the event. *Note: Please check your spam or "Promotions" tab (if a Gmail user) for this Meetup announcement email if it does not appear in your inbox. Email [masked] prior to the event if you do not receive it.*

Agenda (times approximate):
7-7:05 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:05-7:40: Emily & Jacqueline talk about their book
7:40-8:15: Audience Q&A
8:15-8:20: Wrap-up

--- Speaker Bios ---

Emily Robinson is a senior data scientist at Warby Parker, where she works on a centralized team tackling some of the company's projects. She previously worked at DataCamp, where she built and ran their experimentation analytics system, and at Etsy, where she worked with their search team.

Dr. Jacqueline Nolis is a principal data scientist at Brightloom where she creates models to help restaurants and retailers improve the customer experience. She has a PhD in Industrial Engineering, and has over a decade of experience with helping companies use data, ranking from DSW to Airbnb. For fun Jacqueline likes to use data science for humor—like using deep learning to generate offensive license plates.

title: R-Ladies Cuernavaca: Primer Meetup virtual de R-Ladies Cuernavaca: Generación de gráficas con ggplot2
description:
En nuestro primer Meetup virtual de R-Ladies Cuernavaca tendremos una invitada especial, la Dra. Ernestina Godoy Lozano del Instituto Nacional de Salud Pública nos hablará sobre cómo generar gráficas con el paquete ggplot2.

Conocimientos necesarios:
- Manejo de Data frames
- Lectura y escritura de archivos en R.

Fecha: Jueves 23 de julio de 2020.

Este evento se llevará a cabo mediante Zoom, el link para conectarse al evento será enviado por correo electrónico a los asistentes registrados 30 minutos antes de iniciar. Por seguridad de todos, no compartas el link con personas no registradas en el evento.

Les pedimos conectarse 15 minutos antes para corroborar su inscripción. Tendremos 15 minutos de tolerancia (hasta las 16:15) para aceptar su entrada al evento una vez comenzada la sesión.

PROGRAMA
15:45 Conexión a la sesión
16:00 Bienvenida.
16:15 Introducción a ggplot2
17:00 Coffee Break.
17:15 Generación de gráficas.

REQUISITOS:
- Leer y atender el código de conducta disponible en https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/
- Instalar R y RStudio última versión.
- Instalar el paquete ggplot2 con install.packages("ggplot2").

Si no te es posible asistir al evento, por favor cancela tu inscripción al menos 24 horas antes para darle oportunidad a las personas en lista de espera. En caso de mantener tu registro y no presentarte al evento, nos veremos en la necesidad de rechazar tu registro en el siguiente meetup.

title: R-Ladies Concepción: Sesión 3 - Club de lectura - Happy Git with R, de Jenny Bryan
description:
Este miércoles nos reuniremos para la tercera sesión del club de lectura sobre el libro "Happy Git with R" de Jenny Bryan, actividad organizada de manera conjunta entre RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valparaíso y RLadies Concepción. "Happy Git with R" aborda el uso del sistema de control de versiones Git en conjunto con GitHub, R y RStudio. Está disponible de manera gratuita en: https://happygitwithr.com/

¿Cómo funciona el club de lectura?

Divideremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. En cada una de ellas abordaremos una de las secciones del libro. Cada sesión la liderará una relatora de nuestra comunidad.
Esta tercera sesión estará a cargo de Natalia Riquelme (@NatyRiquelmeS). Natalia es egresada de Administración Pública y Ciencia Política y actualmente trabaja como Colaboradora de Investigación Cuantitativa en el proyecto IdeClab de la Universidad de Concepción. Durante la sesión abordaremos la sección III del libro, "Early Github Wins".

- ¿Qué necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro nuestro código de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con él: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
Lo segundo, es haber instalado ya Git en tu computador (https://git-scm.com/) y tener una cuenta en GitHub (https://github.com/). En la sesión anterior abordamos cómo hacer esto. Si no participaste, puedes revisar la primera parte del libro ("Installation") o la primera parte del video de la sesión pasada (https://github.com/rladieschile/club-de-lectura-happy-git).
Lo tercero, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicación Zoom en tu computador. El día del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese día que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesión.

- ¿Qué pasa si no leo en inglés?

¡Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesión hará una síntesis de los puntos más importantes, así que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podrás aprender sobre este tema :)

- Estoy recién aprendiendo sobre R, ¿puedo participar?

Sí. Te sugerimos, eso sí, revisar los vídeos de nuestro taller introductorio: https://github.com/rladieschile/taller-introductorio-mayo. Si bien el foco de estas sesiones no es programar en R, sí es importante estar familiarizada con RStudio como entorno de trabajo.

¡Te esperamos!

title: R-Ladies Concepción: Cómo hacer una reunión virtual inolvidable (sin morir en el intento)
description:
Aunque no es posible reunirnos en persona, la magia de R-Ladies no se detiene y hace posible los encuentros virtuales. En este meetup, realizado a las 13:00 hrs Chile, te contaremos algunos trucos y herramientas para que cualquier evento virtual interactivo (por ejemplo, clase, taller o panel online) sea un éxito sin estrés adicional al hacerlo. Si organizas meetups de R-Ladies, encontrarás dónde y cómo acceder a la infraestructura que te permitirá organizar meetups online para tu capítulo. Si no organizas meetups de R-Ladies, también encontrarás material útil para todo tipo de evento online que organices o del que participes.

Estos contenidos nos los traen R-Ladies latinoamericanas, en su mayoría certificadas para enseñar por RStudio Education y The Carpentries. La mayoría también es parte de MetaDocencia, una organización que desde fines de marzo realizó más de 25 talleres interactivos enseñando a enseñar online a más de 300 docentes hispanohablantes con excelentes resultados. Todas tienen vasta experiencia teletrabajando y enseñando online.

Oradoras: Yanina Bellini Saibene y Paola Corrales.

Organizan: Laura Ación, Yanina Bellini Saibene, Paola Corrales, Patricia Loto y Paloma Rojas

Para tener un evento seguro, el link de acceso al evento lo recibirán quienes confirmen su asistencia via RSVP de meetup.com el día del evento.

title: R-Ladies Concepción: useR! 2020 Tutorial: Seamless R and C++ Integration with Rcpp
description:
The RLadies chapters and the R User Group from Chile are very happy to announce that we will be hosting one of the useR! 2020 online tutorials (https://user2020.r-project.org/program/tutorials/). We will have the honor of having Dirk Eddelbuettel in our meetup, who will be running the tutorial: "Seamless R and C++ Integration with Rcpp" on July 14th, 15:00 UTC.

- Background

R has risen to become the lingua franca of statistical research and applications. At the same time, user demands on computing resources and performance have also increased. This is driven chiefly by the ever-growing size of datasets, and may sometimes be coupled with increases in their complexity. The quest for computing with larger datasets, as well as the ever-present desire to also compute "faster" make complementing the interpreted language-processing at the core of R with native code extensions a natural next step. The Rcpp package has become the principal venue for extending R with compiled code. It makes it easy to extend R with C or C++ spanning the range from simple one-liners to larger routines and bindings of entire external libraries.

- Workshop contents

We will motivate and introduce Rcpp as a natural extension to R that provides an easy-to-use and powerful interface. Helper functions and tools including RStudio will be used to easy creation of R extensions. Several examples will introduce basic use cases including writing code with RcppArmadillo which is the most widely-used package on top of Rcpp.

- Target Audience

R users wanting to go beyond R. Prior experience with compiled languages like C and C++ is helpful but not required.

- About the instructor

Dr Dirk Eddelbuettel has been a (co-)author and maintainer for the Rcpp project since its inception. He works as a senior "quant" in industry combining C++ and R for high-frequency data analysis and predictive models in finance, and teaches a class on Data Science Programming Methods as a Clinical Professor at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. He is author, co-author, or maintainer of sixty CRAN packages, an elected board member of the R Foundation, and a 25+ year contributor to Debian looking after 150+ packages including R.

- Attending the workshop

Please, read carefully the useR! 2020 Code of Conduct: https://user2020.r-project.org/codeofconduct/. All participants are required to agree to it.

The tutorial will start at 15:OO UTC and has a duration of two hours (+ a 10 minutes break). Check your timezone here: https://arewemeetingyet.com/UTC/2020-07-14/15:00/Seamless%20R%20and%20C%2B%2B%20integration%20with%20Rcpp

[UPDATED SECTION]

We'll be hosting the tutorial on Zoom. The link will be shared in the comments of this event half an hour in advanced. The meeting has a waiting room. We'll let everyone in at 15:00 UTC.

For the tutorial you'll need to install Rcpp from CRAN. You will also need a compiler. Please read sections 1.2 and 1.3 on the second page of the Rcpp FAQ to check specific recommendations for Windows/OSX/Linux users: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/Rcpp/vignettes/Rcpp-FAQ.pdf.

We'll be using RStudio. Is not a bad idea to have an rstudio.cloud account as back-up.

title: Newcastle Upon Tyne Data Science Meetup: July Data Science Meet-up (Virtual)
group: Newcastle Upon Tyne Data Science Meetup
description:
Speaker: Nic Crane (UNAI)

Title:
NLP - Beyond Wordclouds, or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Text Data

Abtract:

Six months ago, I found myself on a new work project, wrestling with a type of data I'd never had to encounter before in the wild: text. Whilst having much in common with tabular data, this unstructured format has many of its own special quirks and idiosyncrasies. Now, on the precipice of project completion, I reflect on the challenges I faced, how I overcame them, and share the libraries, techniques, and resources that were instrumental in getting me there.

title: Bamako Data Science: Data Science avec R: s'exprimer dans R
description:
Nous allons poursuivre avec le thème de la semaine dernière. Maintenant que nous avons fait connaissance avec les objets dans R, nous allons apprendre à dialoguer avec eux. C'est à travers ce dialogue, que nous les rendrons vivants et parlants. Cette semaine, nous allons apprendre le language dans lequel se pose ce dialogue. Déclarations, boucles, fonctions...voici quelques termes que nous allons rencontrer.

Challenge: munissez-vous d'une tasse ou d'un verre avec une boisson originale car nous allons trinquer au moment de snapper lol. Moi j'aurai du quinquéliba. Et vous?

Cheers,
Fousseynou.

title: Orange County R Users Group (OCRUG): Book club - Session 12 - Applied Predictive Modeling
description:
The book club is to motivate us to read books and discussing them together. This will help all of us to develop our skills. Xi Chen will be heading up the book club.

The format will be that the leader will prepare a short summary of the material and present it to the group. We will then discuss the material and do some exercises.

The expectations are that you will attend regularly once you sign up for a book. If you cannot, please wait until the next round starts with a new book. It is also expected that participants will take turns being the leader.

We will meet each week, Wednesday evening between 6:30 to 8:00 PM. The location is Zoom if we cannot meet in person. If we can meet, it will be at Panara Bread (see below)

Book: Applied Predictive Modeling
http://appliedpredictivemodeling.com/
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00K15TZU0/

What to bring
* Laptop with R installed
* Book

title: Central Iowa R User Group: R and Python study group
description:
Until we can meet again in person, please join our Slack workspace to stay in touch, ask questions, and share information throughout the week.

https://join.slack.com/t/centraliowarusergroup/shared_invite/zt-dhfa5ude-0tvHascxRkn2pgiqDdQgrw

The Slack workspace is available any time, not just Saturday mornings.

Are you tired of learning and playing with Python and R alone? Would you like to get together with a few friends and learn together? I have been starting to learn R and Python for data science and following the typical route of videos and practice projects. I really want to ramp up my learning and exposure to different ways. Here is my proposal:

- Gather a small group of 2-5 and learn together.
- Meet at a coffee shop, library, or some other space that has Wi-Fi.
- Pick a project, data set or problem, then work to solve it with different tools.
- Keep it fluid and informal.
- Meet on a regular basis, say weekly to start, and adjust as needed.
- Aim to keep the meetings 2-4 hours long, but this can be adjusted to the project or group. People can come and go as needed.
- It does not have to be the same people each time, so you only have to commit to going once to check it out.

Are you interested? Show up at the meeting spot, have some coffee, meet new friends and bring a project or question.

title: STWUR - Wroclaw R Users Group Meetup: Why R? 2020 Conference - Remote!
group: STWUR - Wroclaw R Users Group Meetup
description:
[REGISTRATION STARTS JUNE 1st] - whyr.pl/2020/register/
[SUBMISSIONS STARTS JUNE 1st] - whyr.pl/2020/submit/

We will stream the conference at youtube.com/WhyRFoundation

Why R? 2020 Conference, the fourth meeting of R enthusiasts. It will be held remotely, 24-27 September 2020. As the meeting is held in English, we are happy to invite R users from all over the globe!

Why R? 2020 Conference is an international event of R statistical software users. It is a remarkable occasion to gain knowledge about R, enhance data analysis and processing skills, and meet other members of European R community.

[masked] - Hackathon Registration Starts

title: Spotkania Entuzjastów R-Warsaw RUG Meetup & R-Ladies Warsaw: Supporting grant for Women in Data Science
group: Spotkania Entuzjastów R-Warsaw RUG Meetup & R-Ladies Warsaw
description:
# Website
http://whyr.pl/foundation/supporting-grant/

# Motivation
The aim of the Why R? Foundation is to reinforce the growth of data science in Poland by keeping it balanced and diverse. To do so, since 2018 Why R? Foundation is distributing the Why R? Supporting Grant for Woman in Data Science. The idea is not only to aid exceptional female data scientists but also to showcase them as role models to the whole community.

# Dates

- Grant Applications should be submitted through a dedicated form by 16th August 2020.
- Grant Holder selection information will be published by 20th September 2020 on the Why R? Foundation’s website.

Grant Applicants will be notified about decisions by an e-mail.

# Terms and Conditions
Terms and Conditions of award and disbursement of Why R? Foundation grants for exceptional women scientists from the field of data science are available here http://whyr.pl/foundation/terms-and-conditions.pdf

# Registration form
If you want to apply for the grant please fill this form https://forms.gle/pHrFD7DL7cHC1N2z7

# Scientific committee
Michał Burdukiewicz (amanuensis)
Marta Karas
Marcin Kosiński
Barbara Sobkowiak
Partners

# Partners
Women in Machine Learning and Data Science Poland
RLadies Warsaw

# Acknowledgements
Terms and Conditions of award and disbursement of Why R? Foundation grants for exceptional women scientists from the field of data science were prepared by Leśniewski, Borkiewicz & Partners. Leśniewski, Borkiewicz & Partners is a modern, boutique law firm with a business approach. LB&P works mainly with clients from IT, TMT and e-commerce areas, both within defined projects and as a comprehensive, ongoing service. The main areas of LB&P specialization are negotiating commercial contracts, mergers, acquisitions and restructuring (M&A), personal data protection, legal support in the field of designing mobile applications, image and personal rights protection, cybersecurity, compliance and taxes. For more details please check a website lbplegal.com or LB&P LinkedIn account. https://www.linkedin.com/company/lbplegal/

Coast to Coast for this summer meetup! July's meetup will feature 4 Groups!

Greater Boston useR: https://www.meetup.com/Boston-useR/
San Diego useR: https://www.meetup.com/sd-r-users/
South Coast MA useR: https://www.meetup.com/South-Coast-useR-Group
San Diego R Ladies: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-san-diego/

Talk #1: Andrew Bates, Databases With R:

Using databases directly within R can greatly streamline your workflow. In this talk we will learn how to query databases and return the results as an R data frame. We will show how packages like DBI and dbplyr allow us to use dplyr syntax to run queries against a database and return the results. This allows us to keep our workflow entirely within R, instead of switching contexts between SQL and R. After looking at a few examples, we will cover some tips for incorporating these ideas into our daily work as well as resources for moving beyond the basics.

Talk #2: Asmae Toumi, favorite packages for missing data in R:

Asmae Toumi will give a very broad overview of how to leverage the {naniar} package to explore and visualize missing data, identify patterns of missing data, and impute missing data using the {MICE} package.

Talk #3: Amanda Hart, Tips & tricks for making your own R package:

From plotting to analysis, packages are foundational tools for R users. But what happens when there isn’t an existing package to meet your needs? In this talk, we will learn how to take your own code and turn it into a new R package. We will provide simple steps to get started and tips to add features as you become package-building experts.

Talk #4: Juliana Capitanio, Flexdashboards: Using interactive dashboards to create data visualizations

Juliana Capitanio will show us how to use R Markdown to quickly create a dashboard using the flexdashboards package. These dashboards can compile plots, tables, gauges, value boxes, text annotations and maps into various layouts. Dashboard components are responsive and quickly resize to fit mobile devices. Further, we can easily make dashboard elements interactive by using htmlwidgets for R and/or Shiny.

title: Oslo useR! Group: [Online] Item Response Theory in R – Modelling test results
description:
[About the event]
In this talk, Henrik will present a statistical paradigm called Item Response Theory (IRT). IRT is the preferred statistical framework for modelling educational and psychological scales. In education, IRT is the statistical method used in international assessment programs like PISA and national assessments such as the national tests in Norway. The talk will focus on applications of IRT, specifically making results on different tests comparable and the fairness of educational tests.

[About the speaker]
Henrik Galligani Ræder is a doctoral research fellow at the Centre for Educational Measurement at the University in Oslo (CEMO), Norway. His research focuses on the Norwegian national assessments, vertical scaling of educational tests and the numeracy proficiency of Norwegian students.

title: Sydney Users of  R Forum (SURF): AlphaZetta Global Analytics Summit - Sydney 2020
description:
Registration is required on the AlphaZetta site - links below.

The AlphaZetta Global Analytics Summit is a unique conference experience, built around experts sharing their knowledge, use cases, best practice and having time for meaningful interactions. It is not vendor driven - there’s no booths or selling and no big crowds - we expect only ~150 attendees. The summit provides insightful presentations, fantastic networking and discussion time at great value!

We are delighted that the next GAS will be held in Sydney on Friday 14th August at the Manly Pacific Hotel. Further details including the agenda can be found here ( https://alphazetta.ai/event/global-analytics-summit-sydney-2020/ ).

The day starts with presentations on the current state of the analytics market and key trends to look for in the future. The second section is about inspiring attendees with keynotes from Volt Bank on creating a new business based on data and analytics and from Raiffeisen Bank on building an analytics team to provide true value to the whole organisation.

The afternoon focuses on innovation and implementation. We have presentations from some of Australia’s exciting startups (Volt, Adgile Media, Self Assured Pty Ltd) who are using analytics to disrupt their markets. To close, we will hear a keynote on how to deliver analytics and increase AI adoption.

The Summit venue is the Novotel Pacific, Manly which is right on the ocean beach, with lunch and dinner included.

All up, at just $350 for standard tickets, it’s a conference like no other!

Presenters Include:

Steve Weston - Co-Founder and CEO, Volt Bank

Stephen Brobst - AlphaZetta Advisory Board; Chief Technology Officer, Teradata; TDWI Fellow

title: R-Ladies Bari: Aiutaci a raggiungere il nostro obiettivo con #DeveloperEconomics
description:
È tempo di un nuovo sondaggio per #sviluppatori e data scientists!

Questo non è un evento ma un invito ad aiutarci a raggiungere un obiettivo che ad RLadies Italy ci siamo prefissati con partner di #DeveloperEconomics

*Quali nuovi skills vorresti migliorare nel 2021? Quali strumenti o piattaforme di sviluppo diventeranno obsolete durante il prossimo anno?*

Abbiamo deciso di supportare il nuovo questionario Developer Economics survey Q2 2020 per avere delle risposte.
Il questionario è molto chiaro e diretto al sodo. Condividi le tue opinioni su i più popolari strumenti di sviluppo, piattaforme, tecnologie e framework. Cosa ti piace usare? Cosa hai provato ma poi subito abbandonato perché non abbastanza intuitivo, o cosa vorresti conoscere meglio?

Rispondi a queste domande per aiutarci a scoprire cosa manca sul mercato. Il questionario è aperto solo a sviluppatori e data scientists, ma invita tutti a partecipare: studenti, professionisti, e coloro che si dilettano per hobby. I risultati saranno disponibili in autunno e pubblicati nel nuovo State of the Developer Nation (disponibile gratuitamente per tutti!). Qui avrai grafici e informazioni su trend globali che potrai utilizzare per avere un quadro più amplio e aggiornato del mercato.

Coloro che si registrano e completano il questionario parteciperanno automaticamente all'estrazione di uno dei premi in palio. Il montepremi ammonta a +15 mila $, e sono inclusi premi tipo iPhone 11, Oculus Quest 64GB, JetBrains All Product Pack, Corsair Mechanical Gaming keyboard, Cloud Guru license, più una serie di gadgets e accessori, e vouchers Amazon. Sei pronto per una sfida? Ci sono altri 1000 $ in cash come premio se spargi la voce e altri sviluppatori partecipano al questionario.

Un'altra cosa che è veramente importante è che per ogni questionario completato, doneremo $0.10 a Techfugees per supportare e aiutare gli sviluppatori di domani.

Il questionario è aperto fino al 10 agosto, non perdere quest'occasione!
I risultati del sondaggio sono ciò su cui si basa l'intero ecosistema per creare nuovi strumenti, piattaforme che saranno utilizzate in futuro da voi sviluppatori.

Fallo per R-Ladies Bari. Se arriviamo ad un numero di risposte valide otterremo dei fondi da investire in un progetto congiunto tra RLadies Bari e RLadies Milano.

Inizia qui 🚀
https://developereconomics.net?member_id=rladies_italy&lang=en

title: R-Ladies Cordoba: Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles - useR! 2020
description:
Los capítulos de R-Ladies en Argentina estamos felices de anunciar que Emil Hvitfeldt y Julia Silge se unirán a nosotras para traernos su tutorial "Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles".

¿Alguna vez encontraste datos de texto y sospechaste que había información útil en esos datos?, ¿ Te sentiste con frustración al intentan ver cómo encontrar esa información? ¿Estás familiarizade con los conceptos básicos del modelado predictivo y estás liste para aprender cómo se pueden usar los datos de texto no estructurados para la predicción dentro de los ecosistemas tidyverse y tidymodels?

¿Necesitas un marco flexible para manejar datos de texto que te permitan construir modelos predictivos supervisados?
Los datos de texto son cada vez más importantes en muchos dominios, y los principios de tidymodels se pueden aplicar a las tareas de procesamiento del lenguaje natural. Esta presentación está diseñada para proporcionar orientación práctica y conocimiento directamente aplicable para científiques de datos y analistas que desean integrar texto en sus proyectos de modelado.

En este tutorial de 90 minutos, aprende a preprocesar datos de texto para modelar, entrenar modelos y evaluar el rendimiento del modelo. Usaremos diapositivas y codificación en vivo durante el tutorial para recorrer un estudio de caso realista. El tutorial se transmitirá, grabará y tendrá subtítulos en inglés. También habrá materiales de apoyo y código en GitHub para que puedas trabajar después.

El tutorial está pensando para personas con familiaridad intermedia con R, RStudio, conceptos básicos de modelos de regresión y clasificación y paquetes de tidyverse como dplyr y ggplot2.

Como en todos los eventos de R-Ladies, las personas que participan deben aceptar nuestro Código de Conducta. Para este evento, además adoptamos el Código de Conducta de useR! 2020.

****** IMPORTANTE ******
Para participar y acceder al link de Zoom que publicaremos media hora antes del evento es necesario que hagas click en el botón "ASISTIRÉ".

- English versión

This useR! 2020 online tutorial is coming Friday, July 24, 2020 at 20:00 UTC The R-Ladies chapters from Argentina are happy to announce that Emil Hvitfeldt and Julia Silge will be joining us to run their tutorial "Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles".

Have you ever encountered text data and suspected there was useful insight latent within it but felt frustrated about how to find that insight?
Are you familiar with the basics of predictive modeling, and ready to learn how unstructured text data can be used for prediction within the tidyverse and tidymodels ecosystems?
Do you need a flexible framework for handling text data that empowers you to build supervised predictive models?
Text data is increasingly important in many domains, and tidy modeling principles can be applied to natural language processing tasks. This presentation is designed to provide practical guidance and directly applicable knowledge for data scientists and analysts who want to integrate text into their modeling pipelines.

In this 90-minute tutorial, learn how to preprocess text data for modeling, train models, and evaluate model performance. We will use slides and live coding during the tutorial to walk through a realistic case study. The tutorial will be streamed, recorded, and captioned, and there will be supporting materials and code on GitHub for you to work through afterward.

The tutorial is intended for people with intermediate familiarity with R, RStudio, basics of regression and classification modeling, and tidyverse packages such as dplyr and ggplot2.

As every R-Ladies event, all participants are required to agree to the Code of Conduct. In addition, we also adopt the useR! 2020 Code of Conduct.

****** NOTICE ******
To participate and accesses to the Zoom link that will be published 30 minutes before the meetup, you have to click on the ATTEND button.

title: New York Open Statistical Programming Meetup: Everything Not Tested will Eventually Fail—Testing Shiny Apps Before Production
group: New York Open Statistical Programming Meetup
description:
Continuing our virtual meetups we have another speaker from far away. This month we have Colin Fay from France.

Due to COVID-19 the meetup will take place entirely online. Thank you to EcoHealth Alliance for providing the Zoom link.

Our annual R Conference in New York is also virtual-only. We have an excellent lineup including Max Kuhn, Erin LeDell, Rob Hyndman, Jacqueline Nolis and Andrew Gelman. There are also two-days of workshops covering Machine Learning with tidymodels, git, Shiny, web scraping, GIS & Mapping, EDA with the tidyverse and even scikit-learn. Visit https://rstats.ai/nyr/ for more information and use code nyhackr for a 20% discount.

Since we still can't be together for pizza, Scott's Pizza Tours is sponsoring again and offering everyone 25% off virtual tours booked by July 31. Use code NerdsLovePizza at https://www.scottspizzatours.com/ for the discount.

About the Talk:
You've probably already heard that "Everything not tested will eventually fail", or read that "If you're not writing unit tests, your users are the unit tests"... As extreme as they might sound, these quotes reveal one of the most important things when it comes to production-software: testing should be done as extensively as possible. Most R developers are already familiar with standard package testing, but things can get a little bit different when it comes to interactive web applications: what do we test, why, and how? In this talk, Colin will start by developing the good practices when it comes to testing Shiny, and present some of the tools you can use to test your own applications.

About Colin:
Colin Fay works at ThinkR, a French agency Focused on everything R-related. During the day, he helps companies to take full advantage of the power of R, by providing training, tools and infrastructure. His main areas of expertise are data & software engineering, back-end & infrastructure, and R in production. During the night, Colin is also a hyperactive open source developer and an open data advocate. You can find a lot of his work on his GitHub account (https://github.com/ColinFay) and on ThinkR's account (https://github.com/thinkr-open). He is also active in the Data Science community in France, and an international speaker.

The talk will begin at 7 and we will start admitting people to the event shortly before. Since this is completely remote there will be no pizza but everyone is encouraged to have pizza individually.

El tutorial está pensando para personas con familiaridad intermedia con R, RStudio, conceptos básicos de modelos de regresión y clasificación y paquetes de tidyverse como dplyr y ggplot2.

Como en todos los eventos de R-Ladies, las personas que participan deben aceptar nuestro Código de Conducta. Para este evento, además adoptamos el Código de Conducta de useR! 2020.

****** IMPORTANTE ******
Para participar y acceder al link de Zoom que publicaremos media hora antes del evento es necesario que hagas click en el botón "ASISTIRÉ".

- English versión

This useR! 2020 online tutorial is coming Friday, July 24, 2020 at 20:00 UTC The R-Ladies chapters from Argentina are happy to announce that Emil Hvitfeldt and Julia Silge will be joining us to run their tutorial "Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles".

Have you ever encountered text data and suspected there was useful insight latent within it but felt frustrated about how to find that insight?
Are you familiar with the basics of predictive modeling, and ready to learn how unstructured text data can be used for prediction within the tidyverse and tidymodels ecosystems?
Do you need a flexible framework for handling text data that empowers you to build supervised predictive models?
Text data is increasingly important in many domains, and tidy modeling principles can be applied to natural language processing tasks. This presentation is designed to provide practical guidance and directly applicable knowledge for data scientists and analysts who want to integrate text into their modeling pipelines.

In this 90-minute tutorial, learn how to preprocess text data for modeling, train models, and evaluate model performance. We will use slides and live coding during the tutorial to walk through a realistic case study. The tutorial will be streamed, recorded, and captioned, and there will be supporting materials and code on GitHub for you to work through afterward.

The tutorial is intended for people with intermediate familiarity with R, RStudio, basics of regression and classification modeling, and tidyverse packages such as dplyr and ggplot2.

As every R-Ladies event, all participants are required to agree to the Code of Conduct. In addition, we also adopt the useR! 2020 Code of Conduct.

title: R-Ladies Resistencia-Corrientes: Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles - useR! 2020
Campus useR Group Frankfurt: (Virtual) July Meeting: BYOP
description:
"Bring your own problem" (BYOP) is the topic of our July meeting.

Whether you're stuck with a thing you're working on, you don't know how to tackle your next project in the most efficient way, or you're just not sure what that one error message means – just show the group and we'll discuss ideas and possibilities.

Some problems will be tougher than others, but don't hesitate to bring the (supposedly) easy questions also. As always, useRs of all backgrounds, at all levels of expertise and with all degrees of imposter syndrome are welcome.

Hope to see you again in July - for our fourth virtual useR group meeting.
(Zoom link will be sent out to all registered participants PER E-MAIL about 15 minutes prior to the meetup.)

title: R-Ladies Santiago: Sesión 6 - Club de lectura - Happy Git with R, de Jenny Bryan
description:
Este miércoles nos reuniremos para la sexta y última sesión del club de lectura sobre el libro "Happy Git with R" de Jenny Bryan, actividad organizada de manera conjunta entre RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valparaíso y RLadies Concepción. "Happy Git with R" aborda el uso del sistema de control de versiones Git en conjunto con GitHub, R y RStudio. El libro está disponible de manera gratuita en: https://happygitwithr.com/

- ¿Qué haremos en esta última sesión?

Durante la sesión pondremos en práctica algunos flujos de trabajo colaborativo. Veremos cómo distintas personas pueden colaborar en un mismo repositorio, cómo agregar cambios a un pull request abierto por ti o por otra persona, cómo dejar disponible en GitHub archivos en html como presentaciones y libros en línea, etc. Si te interesa, tendrás la oportunidad de practicar todo esto durante la sesión. Revisa más abajo qué paquetes tienes que tener instalados.

Esta sexta sesión estará liderada por Stephanie Orellana (https://twitter.com/sporella). Stephanie es Ingeniera Agrónoma y Magíster en Recursos Naturales de la PUC y trabaja en consultoría ambiental. Su área de especialización es la Ciencia de Datos Espaciales.

- ¿Qué necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro código de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con él: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

Lo segundo, es haber instalado ya Git en tu computador (https://git-scm.com/) y tener una cuenta en GitHub (https://github.com/). Es importante que estés segura que puedes utilizar Git desde RStudio. Si te resultaron las actividades de la sesión 3, entonces tienes todo lo necesario :)

Lo tercero, es tener instalados los siguientes paquetes en tu computador: usethis, devtools y bookdown.

Lo cuarto, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicación Zoom en tu computador. El día del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese día que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesión.

- Estoy recién aprendiendo sobre R, ¿puedo participar?

Sí. Si bien el foco de estas sesiones no es programar en R, sí es importante estar familiarizada con RStudio como entorno de trabajo. Si quieres, puedes revisar los vídeos de nuestro taller introductorio: https://github.com/rladieschile/taller-introductorio-mayo.

title: R-Ladies Santiago: Cómo preparar una propuesta de presentación para una conferencia/meetup sobre R
description:
La realización de conferencias y meetups sobre R en modalidad virtual es una excelente oportunidad para que grupos menos representados en nuestra comunidad participen en estas instancias. Para muchas personas, la imposibilidad de viajar --sea por la razón que sea-- ha sido un impedimento para poder ser parte de estas actividades. Ahora tenemos una oportunidad que es importante que aprovochemos. Pero ¿cómo preparar una propuesta? ¿Qué debiese incluir el abstract? ¿Para qué conferencia es más apropiada la idea que tengo? ¿Qué debería tener en cuenta al pensar una propuesta de presentación para un meetup? ¿Es lo mismo escribir un abstract para una conferencia de R que para una conferencia en mi disciplina? ¿Qué tengo que incluir en la Bio? Para responder estas preguntas y compartir algunas recomendaciones para diseñar tu propuesta nos juntaremos el próximo sábado 1 de agosto :)

- ¿Y si todavía no tengo una idea para una presentación?

No importa. Durante la sesión hablaremos también sobre cómo generar ideas. Además, para el caso de algunas conferencias hay tiempo todavía. Quizás ahora mismo no se te ocurre nada en particular, pero puedes empezar a planear un proyecto para presentar en alguno de los eventos del próximo año.

- ¿Qué necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro código de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con él: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish. Queremos que nuestros meetups sean un espacio seguro y amable en que todas las personas se sientan cómodas participando.

Lo segundo, es asegurarte de que puedes utilizar la aplicación Zoom en tu computador. El día del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese día que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesión.

- ¿Hay algo más que deba saber sobre este evento?

Esta es una actividad organizada por los capítulos de RLadies de Chile en conjunto con LatinR (https://latin-r.com/), la Conferencia Latinoamericana sobre Uso de R en Investigación + Desarrollo. Queremos más representación de Latinoamérica en las conferencias de R alrededor del mundo y qué mejor que apoyarnos como comunidad para lograrlo.

El taller estará a cargo de Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga).

title: R-Ladies Philly: Hands-on Machine Learning Workshop
description:
Stay tuned for more details!

About our speaker:

Jaclyn Taroni is a Principal Data Scientist at the Childhood Cancer Data Lab, an initiative of Alex's Lemonade Stand Foundation. She was a Postdoctoral Researcher in the Greene Lab at the University of Pennsylvania Perelman School of Medicine, where she worked on cross-platform normalization of gene expression data and unsupervised transfer learning for rare diseases. She conducted her thesis work in the Whitfield Lab at the Geisel School of Medicine at Dartmouth studying the rare autoimmune disease systemic sclerosis, where she developed novel frameworks for analyzing high-throughput molecular data from multiple tissues, clinical manifestations, and drug trials. (http://www.jaclyn-taroni.com/)

title: R-Ladies Philly: Decision Trees & Random Forests
description:
DESCRIPTION:

Decision trees are easy to understand and form the basis for random forest, a powerful machine learning technique. We will build decision tree and random forest models to discover trends using the Philadelphia Police Department’s Complaints Against Police dataset. Please note that we are using the dataset to illustrate statistical and programming techniques and do not have the background in criminal justice to draw any conclusions from our models.

SPEAKER:

Alexandra Parfitt is a graduate student in applied statistics at Villanova University. She is completing a co-op at GlaxoSmithKline in chemical, manufacturing and controls statistics in the biopharmaceutical division. She entered data science and statistics after working in the humanities and she holds an AB from the University of Chicago and a PhD from Yale in comparative literature. She lives in Ardmore with her husband and their four-year-old daughter.

title: R-Ladies Porto Alegre: 7º Meetup R-Ladies Porto Alegre - ONLINE
description:
Olá, Ladies!

Os tempos atuais pedem cuidados especiais, entre eles evitar aglomerações. Assim, nossos encontros presenciais vão precisar esperar. Enquanto isso, que tal testar um novo formato?

Nosso encontro será pelo YouTube desta vez. Inscreva-se no nosso canal! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDCOvchmfUW7gFP5CrSIXrw

Todas são muito bem vindas. Não esqueça de convidar outras ladies a participar! (:

***************
PROGRAMAÇÃO:
***************
Contágio Financeiro de Crises Internacionais no Mercado Brasileiro: Uma Abordagem com Cópulas

Resumo: Este trabalho testa, através da metodologia de cópulas, a hipótese de contágio financeiro entre ações brasileiras e índices de mercado dos países que deram origem às crises do Terror em 2001, da Argentina em 2001, dos Subpprimes em 2007 e do Débito Soberano Europeu em 2009. Além disso, é feita uma análise dos setores econômicos que mais foram afetados por cada crise.

Lívia Linhares - Analista de Pricing no Sicredi. Economista pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais, mestre em Administração/Finanças e doutoranda em Administração/Pesquisa Operacional pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul. R addicted desde 2015 :)

***************
Progressão da epidemia diante de intervenções - Simulador de progressão da Covid-19

Resumo: Pesquisadores do Instituto de Matemática e Estatística (IME) da UFRGS desenvolveram um aplicativo em R Shiny que contém um simulador de epidemias utilizando uma versão alterada do tradicional modelo SIR. Com ele é possível simular cenários para a epidemia considerando diferentes formas de intervenção para seu manejo e diferentes combinações para os parâmetros que regem sua evolução. Uma das ideias do simulador é permitir que o usuário interaja com essas questões e entenda um pouco da complexidade e da incerteza associadas a essas projeções. Link do aplicativo: http://miba-srv01.nuvem.ufrgs.br:8080/shiny/simcovid19/

Gabriela Cybis - Professora do Departamento de Estatística da Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul. Possui graduação em Ciências Biológicas pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul (2007), mestrado em Matemática pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul (2009) e mestrado em Biomathematica pela University of California, Los Angeles (2010) e doutorado em Biomathematica pela University of California, Los Angeles (2014).
***************

Gostaríamos de ver como vocês, ladies, têm usado o R em seus trabalhos e pesquisas, inscreva-se para apresentação! Basta entrar em contato com a gente aqui pelo Meetup ou de nosso Twitter @RLadiesPOA.

title: R-Ladies Cambridge: Reproducible computation at scale with drake
description:
The techniques in this tutorial enhance the maintainability, hygiene, speed, scale, and reproducibility of complicated projects with long runtimes. The drake R package resolves the dependency structure of data analysis pipelines, skips tasks that are already up to date, and cleanly organizes the output. Workflows with drake are efficient to maintain, and they provide tangible evidence that the results are synchronized with the underlying code and data, which increases one’s ability to trust the conclusions of the research.

Learning objectives:
1. Function-oriented programming: participants will learn to express data analysis tasks as user-defined
functions, experience the advantages of functions relative to imperative scripts, and understand the role
of functions in drake-powered projects.
2. Declarative workflows: students will declare targets to represent data analysis artifacts, identify the
dependencies of those targets, and inspect the emergent dependency structures of entire workflows.
3. Project maintenance: students will experience drake’s responses to changing code and data, and they
will understand the conditions that allow drake to skip computation and save time.
4. Large plans: participants will practice declaring large collections of targets compactly using drake’s
domain-specific language.

Computing requirements:
Each participant must have a laptop with a web browser and the ability to connect to the internet. Students will spend most of their time
working through R notebooks and supporting Shiny applications.
• notebooks: https://github.com/wlandau/learndrake/tree/master/inst/notebooks
• learndrakeflow app: https://wlandau.shinyapps.io/learndrakeflow
• learndrakeplans app: https://wlandau.shinyapps.io/learndrakeplans
• drakeplanner app: https://wlandau.shinyapps.io/drakeplanner
Online RStudio Server instances will be provided so participants can interact with the notebooks without
needing to install anything locally.

The instructor:
Will Landau received his PhD in Statistics at Iowa State University in 2016. His dissertation research
introduced a novel fully Bayesian, hierarchical model-driven, GPU-accelerated approach to the analysis of heterosis gene expression data (Landau, Niemi, and Nettleton 2019). He currently works at Eli Lilly and
Company, where he develops capabilities for clinical statisticians.
Will is the creator and maintainer of rOpenSci’s drake R package. His most recent presentations on drake are the rOpenSci Community Call on September 24, 2019 (video recording at https://ropensci.org/commcalls/
2019-09-24) (Landau and Butland 2019) and a half-day workshop at R/Pharma 2019 (Landau 2019).

https://www.linkedin.com/in/wlandau/
https://wlandau.github.io
https://github.com/wlandau

title: R-Ladies Melbourne: Would you like to become a more Confident and Engaging Speaker?
description:
Would you like to become a more confident and engaging speaker?

If YES then be sure to attend July's R-Ladies Melbourne seminar! This month we are excited to welcome Jo Evans, a Public/Online Speaking and Presentation Coach and a TEDx Speaker Trainer.

To support our R-ladies community Jo will share tips on how to master the art of communicating whether it's online or face to face. In this very practical online session we'll look at:

a) How to calm those fears that may well be holding us back from speaking up
b) Explore some great techniques to help us become a more engaging speaker, especially in the online environment
c) In breakout rooms have a go at trying out some of the techniques for ourselves

BEFORE the session, please think of an area of your work or an interest or an idea that you have that you would love to present to a small audience. Think about why your audience will be interested to hear what you have to say. No need to plan a talk but please come prepared with your topic. AND be open to push through any fears, try out new ideas, support each other to become more confident and engaging speakers and have fun! Jo is looking forward to meeting all our members!

Jo's aim is to help people address their fears around speaking, develop confidence and skills in their ability to speak so they can share their message - whatever it is that matters to them.

She has a passion for helping people to become engaging and powerful speakers and to have fun along the way! She has been involved in Presenting at Conferences, Public Speaking and Coaching for over 10 years and is a Distinguished Toastmaster.

To learn more about Jo please have a look at her LinkedIn profile https://www.linkedin.com/in/jo-evans/.

This will be an online event, please be sure to connect a few minutes early for a prompt start at 5:30pm.

We look forward to seeing everyone on the 29th!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: R-Ladies Valparaíso: Sesión 6 - Club de lectura - Happy Git with R, de Jenny Bryan
description:
Este miércoles nos reuniremos para la sexta y última sesión del club de lectura sobre el libro "Happy Git with R" de Jenny Bryan, actividad organizada de manera conjunta entre RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valparaíso y RLadies Concepción. "Happy Git with R" aborda el uso del sistema de control de versiones Git en conjunto con GitHub, R y RStudio. El libro está disponible de manera gratuita en: https://happygitwithr.com/

- ¿Qué haremos en esta última sesión?

Durante la sesión pondremos en práctica algunos flujos de trabajo colaborativo. Veremos cómo distintas personas pueden colaborar en un mismo repositorio, cómo agregar cambios a un pull request abierto por ti o por otra persona, cómo dejar disponible en GitHub archivos en html como presentaciones y libros en línea, etc. Si te interesa, tendrás la oportunidad de practicar todo esto durante la sesión. Revisa más abajo qué paquetes tienes que tener instalados.

Esta sexta sesión estará liderada por Stephanie Orellana (https://twitter.com/sporella). Stephanie es Ingeniera Agrónoma y Magíster en Recursos Naturales de la PUC y trabaja en consultoría ambiental. Su área de especialización es la Ciencia de Datos Espaciales.

- ¿Qué necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro código de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con él: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

Lo segundo, es haber instalado ya Git en tu computador (https://git-scm.com/) y tener una cuenta en GitHub (https://github.com/). Es importante que estés segura que puedes utilizar Git desde RStudio. Si te resultaron las actividades de la sesión 3, entonces tienes todo lo necesario :)

Lo tercero, es tener instalados los siguientes paquetes en tu computador: usethis, devtools y bookdown.

Lo cuarto, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicación Zoom en tu computador. El día del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese día que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesión.

- Estoy recién aprendiendo sobre R, ¿puedo participar?

Sí. Si bien el foco de estas sesiones no es programar en R, sí es importante estar familiarizada con RStudio como entorno de trabajo. Si quieres, puedes revisar los vídeos de nuestro taller introductorio: https://github.com/rladieschile/taller-introductorio-mayo.

title: R-Ladies Valparaíso: Cómo preparar una propuesta de presentación para una conferencia/meetup sobre R
description:
La realización de conferencias y meetups sobre R en modalidad virtual es una excelente oportunidad para que grupos menos representados en nuestra comunidad participen en estas instancias. Para muchas personas, la imposibilidad de viajar --sea por la razón que sea-- ha sido un impedimento para poder ser parte de estas actividades. Ahora tenemos una oportunidad que es importante que aprovochemos. Pero ¿cómo preparar una propuesta? ¿Qué debiese incluir el abstract? ¿Para qué conferencia es más apropiada la idea que tengo? ¿Qué debería tener en cuenta al pensar una propuesta de presentación para un meetup? ¿Es lo mismo escribir un abstract para una conferencia de R que para una conferencia en mi disciplina? ¿Qué tengo que incluir en la Bio? Para responder estas preguntas y compartir algunas recomendaciones para diseñar tu propuesta nos juntaremos el próximo sábado 1 de agosto :)

- ¿Y si todavía no tengo una idea para una presentación?

No importa. Durante la sesión hablaremos también sobre cómo generar ideas. Además, para el caso de algunas conferencias hay tiempo todavía. Quizás ahora mismo no se te ocurre nada en particular, pero puedes empezar a planear un proyecto para presentar en alguno de los eventos del próximo año.

- ¿Qué necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro código de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con él: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish. Queremos que nuestros meetups sean un espacio seguro y amable en que todas las personas se sientan cómodas participando.

Lo segundo, es asegurarte de que puedes utilizar la aplicación Zoom en tu computador. El día del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese día que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesión.

- ¿Hay algo más que deba saber sobre este evento?

Esta es una actividad organizada por los capítulos de RLadies de Chile en conjunto con LatinR (https://latin-r.com/), la Conferencia Latinoamericana sobre Uso de R en Investigación + Desarrollo. Queremos más representación de Latinoamérica en las conferencias de R alrededor del mundo y qué mejor que apoyarnos como comunidad para lograrlo.

El taller estará a cargo de Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga).

title: R-Ladies Cape Town: GBV Prevalence in Kenya: Caroline Akoth (Women in GIS Kenya)
description:
Caroline Akoth is a spatial data scientist and the director of operations and advocacy at Women in GIS Kenya (@WiGISKe on Twitter/ https://wigis.co.ke/). In this talk, she will be sharing their work on mapping gender-based violence in Kenya.

"Gender based violence in Kenya is a health indicator that investigates sexual or physical abuse of persons based on their gender.
SDG 5 on Gender Equality targets to have 0 % prevalence of GBV cases globally. Locally the national policy on prevention and response to GBV hopes to achieve 25 % Prevalence in the next year.
This presentation will look at reporting GBV prevalence in Kenya while highlighting notable trends in counties.
The aim of this project is to further look at how far the country is at achieving 25% Prevalence goal set by the national policy." - Caroline Akoth

After witnessing her informative, moving and empowering talk at satRday2020 in Joburg, we are thrilled to have her back to share her work with our members. We hope that those of you interested in giving a voice to issues affecting South African womxn will be inspired, motivated and equipped to do so!

Please join via the Google Hangouts link. Please MUTE your microphone when you join!

title: R-Ladies Cape Town: Of course I can do the stats for your paper - how to grab opportunities with R
description:
Anandi Bierman, Postdoctoral fellow at Stellenbosch University Department of Conservation Ecology and Entomology, will be sharing her tips and tricks with us on extending your R skillz:

"When a colleague asks you to perform the analysis of their metagenomic data and accompanying statistics with the opportunity to co-author a paper, you can't say no. Luckily R has your back and teaching yourself new skills is something you can achieve from the comfort of your couch. In this talk I will walk you through the steps I took to analyse Metagenomic data using R and the accompanying publication-worthy graphs I learned to draw up as well as some basic statistics done on the metadata.

I will also touch on three things that I found fundamental in the learning process:
(1) Know the good R websites,
(2) Phone a friend and
(3) Don't be shy to re-do a lot of stuff.

The purpose of this talk is to show that you can learn to do anything in R from scratch and produce really professional output and it won't cost you another PhD to do so!"

Join us online - Zoom details to follow soon!

title: R-Ladies Mendoza: Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles - useR! 2020 tutorial
description:
Los capítulos de R-Ladies en Argentina estamos felices de anunciar que Emil Hvitfeldt y Julia Silge se unirán a nosotras para traernos su tutorial "Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles".

¿Alguna vez encontraste datos de texto y sospechaste que había información útil en esos datos?, ¿ Te sentiste con frustración al intentan ver cómo encontrar esa información? ¿Estás familiarizade con los conceptos básicos del modelado predictivo y estás liste para aprender cómo se pueden usar los datos de texto no estructurados para la predicción dentro de los ecosistemas tidyverse y tidymodels?

¿Necesitas un marco flexible para manejar datos de texto que te permitan construir modelos predictivos supervisados?
Los datos de texto son cada vez más importantes en muchos dominios, y los principios de tidymodels se pueden aplicar a las tareas de procesamiento del lenguaje natural. Esta presentación está diseñada para proporcionar orientación práctica y conocimiento directamente aplicable para científiques de datos y analistas que desean integrar texto en sus proyectos de modelado.

En este tutorial de 90 minutos, aprende a preprocesar datos de texto para modelar, entrenar modelos y evaluar el rendimiento del modelo. Usaremos diapositivas y codificación en vivo durante el tutorial para recorrer un estudio de caso realista. El tutorial se transmitirá, grabará y tendrá subtítulos en inglés. También habrá materiales de apoyo y código en GitHub para que puedas trabajar después.

El tutorial está pensando para personas con familiaridad intermedia con R, RStudio, conceptos básicos de modelos de regresión y clasificación y paquetes de tidyverse como dplyr y ggplot2.

Como en todos los eventos de R-Ladies, las personas que participan deben aceptar nuestro Código de Conducta. Para este evento, además adoptamos el Código de Conducta de useR! 2020.

****** IMPORTANTE ******
Para participar y acceder al link de Zoom que publicaremos media hora antes del evento es necesario que hagas click en el botón "ASISTIRÉ".

- English versión

This useR! 2020 online tutorial is coming Friday, July 24, 2020 at 14:00 UTC The R-Ladies chapters from Argentina are happy to announce that Emil Hvitfeldt and Julia Silge will be joining us to run their tutorial "Predictive modeling with text using tidy data principles".

Have you ever encountered text data and suspected there was useful insight latent within it but felt frustrated about how to find that insight?
Are you familiar with the basics of predictive modeling, and ready to learn how unstructured text data can be used for prediction within the tidyverse and tidymodels ecosystems?
Do you need a flexible framework for handling text data that empowers you to build supervised predictive models?
Text data is increasingly important in many domains, and tidy modeling principles can be applied to natural language processing tasks. This presentation is designed to provide practical guidance and directly applicable knowledge for data scientists and analysts who want to integrate text into their modeling pipelines.

In this 90-minute tutorial, learn how to preprocess text data for modeling, train models, and evaluate model performance. We will use slides and live coding during the tutorial to walk through a realistic case study. The tutorial will be streamed, recorded, and captioned, and there will be supporting materials and code on GitHub for you to work through afterward.

The tutorial is intended for people with intermediate familiarity with R, RStudio, basics of regression and classification modeling, and tidyverse packages such as dplyr and ggplot2.

As every R-Ladies event, all participants are required to agree to the Code of Conduct. In addition, we also adopt the useR! 2020 Code of Conduct.

****** NOTICE ******
To participate and accesses to the Zoom link that will be published 30 minutes before the meetup, you have to click on the ATTEND button.
